text.18_Daf, 47_Line: The eight days of the Chag [Sukkot], the eight days of Chanukah, and the first day of Pesach and the first day of Atzeret [Shavuot]
text.18_Daf, 48_Line: And in the diaspora, twenty- one days
text.18_Daf, 43_Line: Why are these [days] different [that the Chalil is played on them]?
text.19_Daf, 4_Line: Rosh Chodesh, which is called a 'Moed', it should be said
text.19_Daf, 28_Line: 'After they entered the Land [of Israel], other lands were not appropriate to sing.'
text.19_Daf, 5_Line: It is not sanctified with [a prohibition against] doing work, as it is written
text.19_Daf, 27_Line: 'Its reading [of the Megillah] is its Hallel', isn't it recorded [in the B'raisa]
text.12_Daf, 0_Line: A woman who dies while sitting on the birthing stool on Shabbos, we bring a knife to tear open her abdomen and remove the fetus
text.18_Daf, 44_Line: Since on these [days] an individual completes the Hallel
text.18_Daf, 42_Line: Twelve days of the year the Chalil is played
text.19_Daf, 19_Line: As it was recorded [according to the B'raisa]
text.19_Daf, 6_Line: "The song shall be for you as [on] the night of the sanctification of the holiday." That [day] which is sanctified as a holiday requires song; that [day] which is not sanctified as a holiday does not require song.
text.19_Daf, 18_Line: But there is the exodus from Egypt, which [occurred] in the diaspora, and we say Hallel?
text.19_Daf, 24_Line: Whereas there, [it fits with what is said] "Praise, servants of Hashem" - and not [ie, are no longer] servants of Pa'aroh; here, "Praise, servants of Hashem" - and not [ie, only those who are no longer] the servants of Achashveirosh
text.32_Daf, 4_Line: "This is the generation of them that seek him that seek thy face, O Jacob. Selah" (Psalms 24:16). R. Yehudah HaNasi and the Rabbis disagreed on how to interpret this verse. One says:
text.29_Daf, 22_Line: And Reish Lakish asks, "Where do we learn this?"
text.18_Daf, 46_Line: [On] eighteen days [of the year] and individual completes the Hallel
text.19_Daf, 9_Line: Master of the World, why does [the nation of] Israel not sing before you on Rosh Hashanah and Yom Hakippurim?
text.29_Daf, 20_Line: "This is the ritual (lit. Torah) for a leper..."
text.19_Daf, 2_Line: Shabbat, which has unique sacrifices, [Hallel] should be said
text.19_Daf, 8_Line: [It is not said] because of [the statement of] R' Abahu, as R' Abahu said, The ministering angels said before Hakadosh Baruch Hu,
text.32_Daf, 5_Line: 'A generation parallels that of its leader.' And one says:
text.29_Daf, 71_Line: ...Death and life are in the power of the tongue; And they that indulge it shall eat the fruit thereof. (Proverbs 18:21)
text.19_Daf, 1_Line: of the Chag [Sukkot] are separate in their sacrifices; [those] of Pesach are not separate in their sacrfices
text.19_Daf, 11_Line: Is it possible that the King sits on the Throne of Judgment, and the books of the live and the books of the dead are open before Him, and [the nation of] Israel sings before Me?
text.18_Daf, 50_Line: Why is the Chag [Sukkot] different, that we say [Hallel] on each day, and why on Pesach do we not say [Hallel]?
text.19_Daf, 16_Line: Because we do not sing on a miracle [that occurred] in the diaspora
text.29_Daf, 23_Line: "If the serpent bites before it is charmed, the charmer has no advantage."
text.19_Daf, 25_Line: [However] we are still servants of Achashveirosh
text.32_Daf, 6_Line: 'A leader parallels that of his generation'
text.29_Daf, 21_Line: this is in reference to the law (lit. Torah) for one who speaks Lashon Harah
text.19_Daf, 12_Line: But [what about] Chanukah, that is not thus [called a Moed] and not thus [sanctified with a prohibition against doing work], and [yet, Hallel] is said?
text.19_Daf, 14_Line: Purim, [when] there is a miracle, it should be said?
text.19_Daf, 20_Line: Before [the nation of] Israel entered the Land [of Israel], all other lands were appropriate to sing. After they entered the Land [of Israel], other lands were not appropriate to sing.
text.18_Daf, 45_Line: As R' Yohanan says in the name of R' Simeon ben Yehotzadak
text.19_Daf, 29_Line: Once they were exiled, [all other lands] were now appropriate as originally [before the nation of Israel entered the Land of Israel].
text.19_Daf, 7_Line: Rosh Hashanah and Yom Hakippurim, which are called 'Moed', and are sanctified with [a prohibtion against] doing work, [Hallel] should be said?
text.19_Daf, 22_Line: Its reading [of the Megillah] is its Hallel
text.31_Daf, 0_Line: This is when it is in public.
text.18_Daf, 49_Line: The nine days of the Chag [Sukkot], the eight days of Chanukah, and the two [first] holy days of Pesach and the two holy days of Atzeret [Shavuot]
